intro: Calliopsis bicolor f. speciosa, commonly known as the showy calliopsis, is a striking flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate foliage and subtle floral display, making it a sought-after addition to native gardens. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, preferring dry to moist conditions depending on the region.
